headline: Defibrillator Market Competitive Landscape Report 2025: Recent Developments, Company Strategies, Sustainability Benchmarking, Product Launches, Key Persons, and Revenue Forecasts
summary: The global defibrillator market is forecasted to expand significantly, increasing from US$ 13.74 billion in 2024 to US$ 25.80 billion by 2033, with a steady CAGR of 7.25%. Key drivers include the proliferation of public access defibrillators, expanded ambulance services, and a surge in cardiac ailments. Defibrillators like AEDs and manual devices remain crucial in enhancing survival rates during cardiac arrest emergencies. Top players such as Medtronic, Boston Scientific, and Philips are pivotal

summary: The global neonatal intensive care market is forecasted to grow from $3.68 billion in 2024 to $6.27 billion by 2033, at a CAGR of 6.10%. Neonatal Intensive Care (NIC) focuses on critically ill newborns, particularly premature or congenital-condition babies. The rise in medical technology boosts survival rates, increasing NICU demand. summary: The respiratory care devices market is projected to grow from $24.16 billion in 2024 to $49.19 billion by 2033, at a CAGR of 8.22%. headline: BioCardia Strengthens Leadership Team with The Addition of Farhan Shahab as Vice President of Quality
summary: SUNNYVALE, Calif., Nov. 24, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BioCardia, Inc. [NASDAQ: BCDA], a global leader in cellular and cell-derived therapeutics for the treatment of cardiovascular and pulmonary diseases, today announces the appointment of Farhan Shahab as Vice President of Quality. Mr. Shahab brings over 25 years of experience to BioCardia in similar executive roles. Mr. Shahab joins BioCardia from Welldoc (a digital health company focused on chronic disease management), where he served as Vice P

headline: Medical Precision Parts Research Report 2025: A $22.42 Bn by 2030, Driven by Automation-Driven Demand for Precision Fluidic Components, Advanced Surface Engineering for Biocompatibility & Anti-Fouling
summary: The global Medical Precision Parts Market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 5.78% from 2024-2030. Driven by lab automation, precision fluidic components like micro-valves and pipetting heads advance personalized medicine. Advanced engineering boosts biocompatibility and anti-fouling, exemplified by Medtronic implants.
